name: Strobogrammatic Number II
title: Strobogrammatic Number II
content:
Given an integer n, return all the strobogrammatic numbers that are of length n. You may return the answer in any order.

A strobogrammatic number is a number that looks the same when rotated 180 degrees (looked at upside down).

 

Example 1:

Input: n = 2
Output: ["11","69","88","96"]

Example 2:

Input: n = 1
Output: ["0","1","8"]

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= n <= 14

discussion_posts.name: stevenye
discussion_posts.content:
For example,
Given n = 2, return ["11","69","88","96"].

I'm just wondering why "00" is not a Strobogrammatic Number.

Thanks!

discussion_posts.name: rache
discussion_posts.content: Why is 101101 not correct for n = 6?

discussion_posts.name: hackthestack
discussion_posts.content: \'1001\' is a Strobogrammatic number but not \'00\', why?

discussion_posts.name: zhyd
discussion_posts.content: A strobogrammatic number is a number that looks the same when rotated 180 degrees (looked at upside down).\n\nSo "0" must be that kind of number. However, it does not appear in the correct answers.

discussion_posts.name: matthewjinmp
discussion_posts.content: this was pain, but its great when you finally do it

discussion_posts.name: algosbolgos
discussion_posts.content:
Chatgpt:  I ask "is 9006 strobogrammatic" 

"9006" rotated 180 degrees becomes "9006" becomes "6009", which is different from the original number.

Therefore, "9006" is not a strobogrammatic number.
OMG!

discussion_posts.name: jink615
discussion_posts.content: I got pretty good results using DP, surprised that its not in the editorial.
